messages.title: My personal pledges to you are:
messages.content: • I will live in Bracknell • Be your full time representative with no second job • Publish my expenses regularly • Hold regular drop-in surgeries throughout the constituency

keyPolicies.policyDescription: It's estimated that £5m will be cut from Bracknell Forest's education budget by 2019, equating to 134 teachers.
Many residents are asking how will they afford to live in Bracknell when they are told that flat here costs from £200k to buy, beyond their capacity and that this must change.
All agree that NHS staff are working beyond their capacity and that this must change.
Instead of threats against Europe, Labour will negotiate a 'soft' Brexit.

issues.brexitEurope: Instead of threats against Europe, Labour will negotiate a 'soft' Brexit.
issues.education: It's estimated that £5m will be cut from Bracknell Forest's education budget by 2019, equating to 134 teachers.
issues.health: All agree that NHS staff are working beyond their capacity and that this must change.

housing.content: Many residents are asking how will they afford to live in Bracknell when they are told that flat here costs from £200k to buy, beyond their capacity and that this must change.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have lived in Bracknell for twenty years, currently in Priestwood. I am a trustee of two local elderly Day Centres, and the local community centre. I am interested in ensuring that the elderly of Bracknell have access to quality services, allowing those over sixty-five to enjoy a safe and full life.

politicalExperience.role: Consultant to Small and Medium Enterprises within the Thames Valley area
politicalExperience.achievements: I have extensive public and private sector experience in the UK, USA and Europe.

images.caption: Paul Bidwell with another individual, both wearing Labour Party badges.

leaflet.additionalNotes: This election is about the future of education, housing and our NHS.
